knimeNode.name: Kafka Consumer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows to consume messages from Kafka.

fullDescription.intro: This node allows to consume messages from Kafka for given topics and to store them in a table.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: An id string to pass to the server when making requests. The purpose of this is to be able to track the source of requests beyond just ip/port by allowing a logical application name to be included in server-side request logging.
A unique string that identifies the consumer group this consumer belongs to.
The time, in milliseconds, spent waiting in poll if data is not available in the buffer. If 0, returns immediately with any records that are currently available in the buffer.

option.name: Max number of messages per poll

tab.option: The maximum number of messages polled in a single request.

option.name: Max empty polls (-1 for infinite)
option.p:
Defines after how many successive empty polls the node is allowed to finish its execution.
If the value is set to -1, which is only allowed if this node is executed in streaming-mode, the consumer will indefinitely poll messages.
If the values is set to -1 the relevant timeouts should be adapted in order to reduce overhead due to re-connecting and rebalancing.

option.name: Topics
option.p: A pattern or list of topics the consumer has to subscribe to.
A pattern has to be a regular expression as defined here. The topics list has to be in the form topic1,topic2,....

tab.option: If this option is selected, the value of topics will be treated as a pattern, and as a list otherwise.
If this option is selected, an additional column is added to the output table containing information about the name of the topic the message/row originates from.
If this option is selected the consumed messages are converted from String to JSON.

tab.name: Advanced Settings
tab.option: Allows to specify additional consumer related options, e.g., poll interval and session timeout. .

ports.inPort: Connection details used to create the Kafka Consumer
ports.outPort: Data table storing all the consumed messages
